benchmark_details.name: WhatifVideo-1.0
benchmark_details.overview: WhatifVideo-1.0 is a new evaluation dataset for open-ended action editing in video, which includes scenarios ranging from simple to complex, and interactions involving multiple people and human-object interactions.
benchmark_details.data_type: video with questions and text prompts

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to evaluate the performance and robustness of models designed for dynamic human action editing in videos based on text prompts.

data.source: WhatifVideo-1.0 dataset includes videos collected for evaluating video editing methods focusing on human actions.
data.annotation: Each video is annotated with captions and designed counterfactual questions.

methods: Quantitative evaluation using pretrained VideoCLIP and CLIP
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on video similarities and consistency to the source video and ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in Vid-Acc and Vid-Con indicate better performance in editing fidelity and consistency.
methodology.validation: Evaluation is performed against other video editing methods using metrics in the benchmark.
